error.signature: error[E0015]: cannot call non-const fn in constants

verdict.summary: Trying to call a runtime function in a const context (const, static, or const fn).

dead_ends.action: Using unsafe to bypass the const restriction
dead_ends.why_fails: unsafe doesn't make non-const functions callable in const context

dead_ends.action: Using a different type that has const constructors

workarounds.action: Use lazy_static! or std::sync::LazyLock for runtime-initialized static values
workarounds.how: lazy_static! { static ref DATA: Vec<i32> = compute(); }

workarounds.action: Move the initialization to a const fn if possible
workarounds.how: Mark the function as const fn if all its operations are const-evaluable
